div.p:
The p/c has Box 1.15 pencilled on it - check location entry.
The reports are issued as occasions arise.
M is clearly replying to T. Ware to M, 14 February 1873 (in this edition as 73-02-14b). Those of 1865 and 1869 are the two last. The disorganisation of the Department through the transfer of the Forest Inspector to the botanic Garden from 1869 til 1872
William Ferguson, who was removed from the Botanic garden in September 1872; see M to J. Casey, 16 September 1872, n. 10. rendered the issue of a general connected Document by the Director an impossibility. It is however his intention to prepare a report again for Parliament in the course of this year. It is not the rule to offer regular reports in most of the Governments Departments. Thus, I believe, no regular reports are issued respecting the parks under the Board of Land & Works
